title: How to Make Gnocchi Alla Puttanesca

steps.headline: Place a stove-top wok over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the anchovies with oil as well as the garlic cloves. Dust with black pepper, caramelize until anchovies liquify---gently mix with a spatula.

steps.headline: Pour in the diced tomatoes over the caramelized fish/garlic mix.
steps.description: Add the bell pepper and tomato pastes; then, spoon in the cinnamon, oregano, chili flakes, and sea salt. Mix thoroughly, bring to a simmer.

steps.headline: Boil 5 cups of water in a large pot over high heat on a separate burner.
steps.description: Add roughly two teaspoons of coarse sea salt and two tea spoons of olive oil.

steps.headline: Add gnocchi to the boiling water.
steps.description: When the gnocchi surfaces---it's done! Strain once finished.

steps.headline: Remove the simmering puttanesca from heat.
steps.description: Incorporate the strained gnocchi into the sauce. Add the capers. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and parmesan cheese.

text: Place a stove-top wok over medium heat. Add the anchovies with oil as well as the garlic cloves. Dust with black pepper, caramelize until anchovies liquify---gently mix with a spatula. Pour in the diced tomatoes over the caramelized fish/garlic mix. Add the bell pepper and tomato pastes; then, spoon in the cinnamon, oregano, chili flakes, and sea salt. Mix thoroughly, bring to a simmer. Boil 5 cups of water in a large pot over high heat on a separate burner. Add roughly two teaspoons of coarse sea salt and two tea spoons of olive oil. Add gnocchi to the boiling water. When the gnocchi surfaces---it's done! Strain once finished. Remove the simmering puttanesca from heat. Incorporate the strained gnocchi into the sauce. Add the capers. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and parmesan cheese. Finished.
